push ha ha didn't I die God all right
I've got 30 years ago The Deer Hunter
won the Oscar for Best Picture it was
part of the first wave of Hollywood
movies to deal with the war in Vietnam
and those movies were an important part
of the national conversation but the war
itself actually doesn't take up that
much of the deer hunters running time
and the parts that take place in Vietnam
don't really tell you very much about
what was happening movies really about
the effects of the war on the men who
fought it and on the communities that
they left behind in some ways the Deer
Hunter resembles a movie like American
Graffiti more than it resembled
Apocalypse Now it's about a group of
friends coming of age together in a
factory town in the 1960s they got off
work at the steel mill they go out
drinking one of them gets married the
next day they go out drinking again then
they go hunting through it all they
fight they laugh they curse they flirt
they sing the three characters who
really stand out and the three
performances that distinguish themselves
in a movie that's full of them are Nick
who's played by Christopher Walken his
girlfriend Linda played by Meryl Streep
and his best friend Michael who's played
by Robert De Niro
Nick Michael and another friend of their
Steve played by John Savage I'll go off
together to fight in Vietnam Mike Mike
Jesus Christ hey their individual faiths
are less important than the impact that
their war experience has on their
relationships with each other with the
people around them and on the community
as a whole the most powerful thing about
the dear hundred is that it shows on a
very intimate local scale how the
Vietnam War changed people changed
communities and changed this country
